meanings.definition: To relieve (someone) of a burden or load.
meanings.sent1: She helped unburden her friend by carrying the heavy groceries.
meanings.sent2: After a long day, he felt much better once he unburdened himself of all his worries.
meanings.sent3: The backpack seemed to unburden itself magically, floating in the air.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had the power to unburden the weight of any heart it touched.
meanings.sent5: The act of sharing can unburden the soul and strengthen the bond between friends.

meanings.definition: To disclose or confess (something) to someone.
meanings.sent1: He decided to unburden his secret to his closest friend.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of relief after unburdening her guilt to the priest.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to unburden its mischief by knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The old tree unburdened its stories to the wind, whispering them away.
meanings.sent5: In the quiet of the night, he unburdened his fears to the stars, hoping for solace.
